dialogue: I didn’t get that. I feel like you have to come from a certain background to feel that irony.
Right. Nobody registers the mother who is trying to engage.
Oh, my kid and I have this joke about fiddlehead ferns.
It’s like - we call them FEEEDLE DEE DEE ferns.
You probably have to be there. He has this little two year old accent. It’s like a lisp. ‘feeeedle dee dee’.
Could I have the cavatelli but without the chantrelles?
Let’s call a spade a spade - the show was the most important artistic event of our lifetime.
I’m a cow. I’m a zen cow in a soothing green field.
Oop. This kale. It’s just pushing it down further: all my rage and disappointment. I thought I had digested it. But it’s still down there.
Burning a hole in me. And the woman I used to be - the talented and plucky young woman with big ideas-
She’s down there also. In my intestines, buried in kale, biding her time. Or maybe she’s dead. Suffocated.

And here I am. Up here. In the beautiful lighting of this beautiful fucking restaurant. Just a middle aged saggy mom without a single intelligent comment to add to the conversation. Insignificant. Oh.
I’m dying to get to the nighttime exhibit at the Rubin!
Insignificant. Oh, this kale is not sitting well.
I’m really into this show- like blown away. It’s very provocative. Very you.
